categories.name: AI Coding Assistants
categories.description: AI-powered tools that help developers write, edit, and debug code faster

categories.name: LLM Providers
categories.description: Companies offering large language model APIs for building AI applications

categories.name: LLM Frameworks
categories.description: Libraries and frameworks for building applications with large language models

categories.name: Vector Databases
categories.description: Databases optimized for storing and searching vector embeddings

categories.name: ML Frameworks
categories.description: Core frameworks for training and deploying machine learning models

categories.name: ML Platforms
categories.description: Platforms for hosting, sharing, and deploying ML models

tools.name: Cursor
tools.description: AI-first code editor built on VS Code with deep LLM integration for code generation, editing, and chat
tools.best_for: Developers who want AI deeply integrated into their coding workflow
pros: VS Code familiarity with AI superpowers
cons: Can be slow on large codebases
Extension ecosystem smaller than VS Code

tools.name: GitHub Copilot
tools.description: AI pair programmer from GitHub/Microsoft with inline suggestions and chat powered by OpenAI models
tools.best_for: Teams already in the GitHub ecosystem wanting seamless AI integration

tools.name: Claude Code
tools.description: Anthropic's agentic coding tool that runs in the terminal and can autonomously execute multi-step coding tasks
tools.pricing: Usage-based via Anthropic API, ~$3 per hour of active use
tools.best_for: Developers comfortable with terminal who want maximum AI agency

tools.name: Windsurf
tools.description: AI IDE from Codeium with 'Cascade' agentic features and free tier
tools.best_for: Developers wanting Cursor-like features without the price tag

tools.name: v0 by Vercel
tools.description: Vercel's AI UI generator that creates production-ready React components from natural language prompts using shadcn/ui
tools.best_for: Frontend developers building React/Tailwind apps who want to accelerate UI development

tools.name: OpenAI
tools.description: Creator of GPT-4, ChatGPT, and the leading provider of LLM APIs for enterprise and consumer applications
tools.best_for: Teams building AI products who need the most capable general-purpose models

tools.name: Anthropic
tools.description: AI safety company behind Claude models, known for longer context windows and thoughtful responses
tools.best_for: Teams needing long context, coding assistance, or safety-focused AI

tools.name: Google AI
tools.description: Google's AI division offering Gemini models, Vertex AI, and enterprise ML services
tools.best_for: Teams in Google Cloud ecosystem or needing multimodal capabilities

tools.name: LangChain
tools.description: Popular framework for building LLM applications with chains, agents, memory, and RAG components
tools.best_for: Teams building complex LLM applications with multiple components
cons: Can be over-engineered for simple use cases

tools.name: LlamaIndex
tools.description: Data framework for LLM applications specializing in connecting custom data sources for RAG
tools.best_for: Teams building RAG applications with complex data ingestion needs

tools.name: Pinecone
tools.description: Managed vector database for similarity search, popular choice for production RAG applications
tools.best_for: Teams wanting managed vector search without ops overhead

tools.name: Weaviate
tools.description: Open-source vector database with built-in ML model integration and hybrid search
tools.pricing: Open source self-hosted, Weaviate Cloud from $0
tools.best_for: Teams wanting more control or hybrid search capabilities

tools.name: Chroma
tools.description: Open-source embedding database designed for simplicity and LangChain integration
tools.best_for: Developers prototyping or building smaller-scale RAG applications

tools.name: PyTorch
tools.description: Open-source ML framework from Meta, the standard for research and increasingly production
tools.best_for: ML engineers and researchers training custom models

tools.name: TensorFlow
tools.description: Google's open-source ML platform with strong production deployment and mobile support
tools.best_for: Teams deploying to production or mobile/edge devices

tools.name: Hugging Face
tools.description: The GitHub of machine learning - hub for models, datasets, and ML collaboration
tools.pricing: Free for public, Pro $9/month, Enterprise custom
tools.best_for: Anyone working with pre-trained models or sharing ML work

comparisons.title: Cursor vs GitHub Copilot
comparisons.description: The AI code editor vs the AI extension. Different philosophies, different price points.

comparisons.title: Cursor vs Windsurf
comparisons.description: Two AI-first code editors competing for developers. Cursor is the incumbent, Windsurf the challenger.

comparisons.title: LangChain vs LlamaIndex
comparisons.description: The two dominant LLM frameworks. LangChain is the Swiss Army knife, LlamaIndex the RAG specialist.

comparisons.title: Pinecone vs Weaviate
comparisons.description: Managed simplicity vs open-source flexibility. The top two vector database choices.

comparisons.title: OpenAI vs Anthropic
comparisons.description: GPT-4 vs Claude. The two leading LLM providers for enterprise applications.

alternatives.title: Cursor Alternatives
alternatives.description: Looking for Cursor alternatives? Compare AI coding assistants with different approaches and price points.
comparison_points: GitHub Copilot works in any IDE and costs half as much
Windsurf offers similar features with a more generous free tier
Claude Code takes a terminal-first agentic approach

alternatives.title: LangChain Alternatives
alternatives.description: Exploring LangChain alternatives? Find the right LLM framework for your use case.
comparison_points: LlamaIndex is simpler and better for pure RAG applications
Direct API calls work fine for simple applications
